bibl.title: Alexandria, the Mouseion, and Cultural Identity.

series.title: Centre for Hellenic Studies. King's College London. Publications.

bibl.note: "I have tried to argue that the early Ptolemies did have a deliberate cultural policy, whose aim was to preserve their Greekness, and safeguard their Greek cultural heritage from amalgamation with, or absorption by, the surrounding Egyptian civilization."
bibl.seg: MAEHLER Herwig, Alexandria, the Mouseion, and Cultural Identity.
Anthony HIRST and Michael SILK (Edd.), Alexandria, Real and Imagined = Centre for Hellenic Studies. King's College London. Publications. 5 (Aldershot, 2004) pp. 1-14.

"I have tried to argue that the early Ptolemies did have a deliberate cultural policy, whose aim was to preserve their Greekness, and safeguard their Greek cultural heritage from amalgamation with, or absorption by, the surrounding Egyptian civilization."
